Nigiri Salmon: 1 (4 to 6 ounce) piece sushi grade tuna or salmon
3 1/3 cup short grain sushi rice, rinsed
5 1/3 tablespoons sushi vinegar, or 5 1/3 tablespoons rice vinegar, 5 tablespoons sugar and 3 tablespoons
Nigiri Tuna: 4 ounces sushi grade fresh ahi tuna or 4 ounces albacore tuna
Nigiri Ebi: 5 tablespoons sushi rice, already cooked and cooled
Nigiri Avocado: 1 medium carrot, cut into thin strips
1 small cucumber, peeled, seeded and cut into thin strips
1 whole avocado, cut into thin strips
Sake Mango: 1 cup julienne cucumbers, peels and seeds removed
1/4 cup chopped green onions, green part only
2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons peeled and grated fresh ginger root
Tartar White: 4 ounces (about 3/4 cup) whole almonds, well toasted
Salmon Roll: 200 g smoked salmon , from sustainable sources, ask your fishmonger
Green Dragon Roll: 1/4 cup old fashioned rolled oats, gluten free if desired
1/4 cup white whole wheat or gluten free oat flour
1 small sweet potato, grated (~1/2 cup, squeezed)
1/2 tablespoon green dragon or hot sauce
Crab Roll: 2 bunches scallions, white and light-green parts only, thinly sliced
Surimi Thin Roll: 4 scallions, cut lengthwise into thin 1 inch strips (about 3/4 cup)
1 large seedless cucumber, quartered lengthwise, cored, and chopped (about 1 pound)
2 sheets nori (paper-thin sheets of dried seaweed)
1 lb surimi, if desired, sliced thin (mock crab legs) (optional)
2 teaspoons ginger juice (squeezed from freshly grated gingerroot)
Tuna Thin Roll: * 2 fresh hard boiled egg peeled and sliced thickly
* coarse salt and pepper to taste
Avocado Thin Roll: scant 1/4 teaspoon fine grain sea salt
6 ounces pan-fried tofu, cut into thin strips
Salmon Thin Roll: 4 oz chive and onion cream cheese
1 cucumber, deseeded and sliced into thin strips
Salmon Temaki: 8 thin slices very fresh Salmon (150 grams)
Spicy Temaki: 3 cups Cooked Short Grain Rice, Cooked According To Package Instructions
Lemon Tori: 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts (cut into bite sized pieces)
2 large garlic cloves, peeled and grated
Spicy Tori: 1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups of onion)
1 lb. cauliflower, chopped into very small florets
2 leeks, white and green parts only, halved, washed carefully, and chopped)
1 tbsp chopped fresh thyme or 1 tsp dried thyme
1/2 tsp cayenne (very spicy-- add 1/4 tsp or less for a milder flavor)
1 large can (32 oz) diced tomatoes with juice
Breaded Shrimp: 2 8-ounce boxes frozen popcorn shrimp or breaded shrimp
Breaded Calamar: 300 grams of broad beans (if you MUST use frozen, then defrost them before cooking)
2 to 3 garlic cloves, peeled and very finely sliced or chopped
1 medium onion peeled and diced very finely
1 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley (or half a teaspoon if using dried)
2 slices of bread(French stick or ciabatta work really well for this)
Spring Rolls: For the Sweet and Sour Sauce:
1 medium clove garlic, finely chopped (about 1 teaspoon)
About 1 quart peanut or vegetable oil, for frying
Uramaki: 4 tablespoons Trout roe (or red lumpfish roe)
